synopsis: In the original story entitled "Hurricane," a young wife taking care of her rich old husband, who is dying on a solitary island, and his secretary ask Black Jack to prolong the man's life until they can finish altering his will.

Black Jack meets four girls in a northern town. Some months later, he chances upon one of them again and finds out that two of the original groups are dead and another has become a vegetable following an accident.

This story is based on the Manga episode "Promise". In the original story, Black Jack gives first-aid treatment to a revolutionary soldier sheltered at a refugee camp where there are no medical supplies or drugs.
This is an original story inspired by the works "Black Mirror Image" and "Death of a Movie Star".

title.jp: Karte 5: The Owl of San Merida

synopsis: The story is inspired by "A Passed Moment." In the original, Black Jack finds on a taxi driver's back a scar from an operation that indicates that the surgeon is more skillful than even Black Jack himself.

title.jp: Karte 6: Tale of a Snowy Night: the Lovelorn Princess

synopsis: There also is an episode called “Tale of a Snowy Night” in the original story, but apart from that, a completely different story is told in this episode.
A civil war breaks out in the Middle East. Black Jack fearlessly marches into a refugee camp following his patient Karen.
A boy who is gradually turning into a plant sprouts buds from his body.
Tsuzuki Koichiro, who is in his early 30's, takes over as representative of the Tsuzuki Group-one of the leading zaibatsu in the world.
"Crescent Disease" is caused by environmental pollution. It causes symptoms among the residents who eat fish caught in the Crescent Gulf.
